population_specificity: Nulliparous women in labor with a minimum pain score of 5 (0-10 scale) at a university hospital in Malaysia.
effective_dosage: 30 minutes of mechanical massage followed by 30 minutes without (or vice versa).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of massage therapy on blood pressure in patients with hypertension.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found a minimal reduction in systolic and diastolic blood pressure among hypertensive patients, with considerable heterogeneity in the results. Further large-scale studies are recommended to confirm these findings.
population_specificity: Patients with hypertension (290 participants across six studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of calf muscle massage on ankle dorsiflexion range of motion in adults with residual restricted dorsiflexion and assess the methodology for a larger trial.
results_summary: Calf muscle massage significantly increased ankle dorsiflexion (change score = 0.91 ± 1.07, p < 0.001), with no significant difference compared to ankle joint mobilization. The pilot study identified limitations for future research.
population_specificity: 25 healthy participants with a history of lower limb injury.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical effect of sexual therapy combined with vacuum negative pressure hydropneumatic/pneumatic bubble massage (VNPHP/PBM) on primary intravaginal anejaculation (PIAJ) and explore its possible mechanism.
results_summary: The combination of sexual therapy and VNPHP/PBM showed a higher total effective rate (84.38%) compared to either treatment alone, with improvements in anxiety levels and sexual behavior patterns but no changes in penile sensitivity measures.
population_specificity: 95 male patients with primary intravaginal anejaculation (PIAJ).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness of pediatric massage (PM) combined with home-based exercise programs (HEPs) in reducing spasticity and improving gross motor ability in children with spastic cerebral palsy.
results_summary: The PM group showed a statistically significant reduction in spasticity (MAS scores) after six and 12 weeks compared to the HEP group. Both groups demonstrated significant improvements in gross motor function (GMFM scores and GMFCS levels) from baseline to 12 weeks, though PM did not show additional benefits over HEP alone in these measures.
population_specificity: Children aged 4-12 years with spastic cerebral palsy (diplegia).
effective_dosage: Pediatric massage provided five times a week (specific duration per session not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether replacing traditional mustard oil with sunflower seed oil for newborn massage could reduce neonatal mortality and morbidity in South Asian communities.
results_summary: The study found no statistically significant reduction in neonatal mortality or serious bacterial infection rates when using sunflower seed oil instead of mustard oil for newborn massage, though a modest but non-significant benefit was observed among preterm infants.
population_specificity: Newborns in 340 communities in Sarlahi, Nepal, including preterm infants.
effective_dosage: Daily newborn massage with provided oil (mustard oil or sunflower seed oil) during the first month postpartum.
study_duration: First month postpartum, with follow-up visits through the first 28 days of life.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of dynamic ultrasonography in identifying the optimal patient position and the role of abdominal massage in improving outcomes for SMA syndrome.
results_summary: The study found that dynamic ultrasonography helped identify individualized optimal positions for SMA syndrome patients, and abdominal massage on the right side enhanced duodenal content passage in one case. Both patients showed rapid recovery with these interventions.
population_specificity: Elderly patients (90-year-old man and 87-year-old woman) with SMA syndrome.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the benefits and harms of massage compared to placebo, no treatment, or exercise for acute to chronic neck pain in adults, including conditions like radiculopathy and cervicogenic headache.
results_summary: Low-certainty evidence suggests massage probably results in little to no difference in pain, function-disability, and quality of life compared to placebo for subacute-chronic neck pain at up to 12 weeks. A high dose (≥8 sessions over four weeks) showed a clinically important difference.
population_specificity: Adults aged 18-70 (70% female) with subacute-chronic neck pain, including non-specific neck pain (85%), radiculopathy (6%), and cervicogenic headache (9%).
effective_dosage: High dose: ≥8 sessions over four weeks for ≥30 minutes duration.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of different acupuncture-related treatments, including massage, combined with rehabilitation training on sensory impairment and daily living ability in stroke patients.
results_summary: The study found that acupuncture plus massage plus rehabilitation significantly reduced Numbness Syndrome Scores compared to standard rehabilitation. However, acupuncture combined with rehabilitation alone showed the most substantial improvement in Sensory Impairment Scores and daily living ability.
population_specificity: Patients with stroke experiencing sensory disorders.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of eyelid massage device (EMD) with other treatments (IPL, HEM, VTPS) on improving signs and symptoms of evaporative dry eye (EDE).
results_summary: The study protocol outlines a comparison of EMD with other treatments, but specific results for EMD are not detailed in the abstract. Outcomes measured include non-invasive tear breakup time (NITBUT), TFLL score, meibomian gland quality, and other ocular parameters.
population_specificity: Patients with evaporative dry eye (EDE).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review existing therapies for Parkinson's disease, including massage, and explore new drug therapies.
results_summary: The abstract mentions that PD patients utilize massage among other therapies, but no specific findings about its effects are provided.
population_specificity: Patients with Parkinson's disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review existing literature on the associations between non-sexual social touch (including massage) and sleep quality, and to identify potential mechanisms underlying these associations.
results_summary: The study found that touch therapies like massage have positive effects on sleep quality, particularly in clinical populations. The existing research supports massage as a predictor of better sleep quality, though future studies are needed to clarify specific mechanisms and boundary conditions.
population_specificity: Clinical populations (specific conditions not detailed in the abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the impact of age on quality of life (QoL) in patients who underwent cardiac surgery with extracorporeal life support (ECLS) treatment, including cases involving external cardiac massage.
results_summary: The study found that QoL in elderly patients surviving ECLS treatment was almost comparable to younger patients, despite high mortality rates, particularly in the elderly. External cardiac massage was used in 45.7% of cases during cardiogenic shock.
population_specificity: 200 patients who underwent cardiac surgery with ECLS treatment, divided into two groups (≤70 years and >70 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether parental stroking at a speed of 3 cm/s before a heel lance could effectively reduce neonatal pain by activating C-tactile nerve fibers.
results_summary: Parental stroking before the heel lance did not significantly reduce pain-related brain activity, PIPP-R scores, or tachycardia development compared to stroking after the procedure. No significant differences were observed in secondary outcomes, including parental anxiety.
population_specificity: Neonates born at ≥35 weeks gestational age requiring a heel lance blood test in the first week of life.
effective_dosage: 10 seconds of parental stroking at ~3 cm/s.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of manual therapy (including massage) and electrotherapy for treating primary dysmenorrhea in women.
results_summary: The study found that manual therapy, including effleurage massage, significantly reduced pain intensity and duration, with long-term effects observed. Quality of life and anxiety levels also improved with manual therapy interventions.
population_specificity: Women with primary dysmenorrhea.
effective_dosage: Not specified (few sessions mentioned for transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation combined with thermotherapy and effleurage massage).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate pain management recommendations in COPD clinical practice guidelines, including the role of massage.
results_summary: Only one CPG mentioned massage as a pain management technique, alongside relaxation and breathing, indicating limited evidence or focus on massage in COPD pain management.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a structured approach for managing calcium hydroxylapatite (CaHA) nodules, including the use of massage as a treatment method.
results_summary: Massage (Level 1 intervention) demonstrated high success rates, cost-effectiveness, and minimal invasiveness in treating CaHA nodules. It was presented as a preferred initial treatment option before more invasive methods.
population_specificity: Patients with CaHA dermal filler-induced nodules (noninflammatory).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether proximal massage and palm fisting could prevent phlebitis in patients with peripheral venous catheters (PVCs).
results_summary: The study found that proximal massage and palm fisting significantly increased the risk of PVC-induced phlebitis at 48 and 96 hours compared to standard care, despite initial promising suggestions of prevention.
population_specificity: Hospitalized patients in the orthopaedics and traumatology service of a state hospital with PVCs.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of nonpharmacologic pain relief therapies, including massage, in adults undergoing cardiac surgeries.
results_summary: Massage therapy was the most commonly examined nonpharmacologic intervention and, when combined with pharmacologic therapy, was found to be effective in relieving postoperative pain after cardiac surgeries. However, most studies had significant methodological flaws.
population_specificity: Adults undergoing cardiac surgeries

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether myofascial reorganization® in the trapezius muscle (MRT) improves muscle oxygenation, pain tolerance, and reduces neck disability in individuals with and without nonspecific neck pain.
results_summary: MRT significantly reduced neck disability scores and increased muscle oxygenation compared to sham massage and control groups, while the control group showed higher pain tolerance post-intervention.
population_specificity: Adults aged 18-32 with and without nonspecific neck pain.
effective_dosage: 10 minutes once a week for 6 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the impact of aromatherapy, including massage, on nausea and vomiting in cancer patients.
results_summary: Aromatherapy, particularly via massage, reduced nausea and vomiting in cancer patients, with significant efficacy in chemotherapy-induced cases. Peppermint oil was notably effective.
population_specificity: Cancer patients aged 18 years or older.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize and analyze common Traditional Chinese Medicine therapies, including Massage, for treating rotator cuff injuries to provide new clinical treatment ideas.
results_summary: The study found that Massage therapy, among other TCM treatments, made a great clinical effect in addressing rotator cuff injuries, though specific efficacy details were not provided.
population_specificity: Patients with rotator cuff injuries (specific demographics not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify factors predicting readiness to adopt self-knee massage among individuals with knee osteoarthritis or chronic knee pain and to determine relevant behavioral determinants using the COM-B model.
results_summary: Participants with knee osteoarthritis or higher pain levels showed greater readiness (action/contemplation stages) for self-knee massage. Capability and motivation (but not opportunity) predicted self-administered massage behavior, with pain level influencing motivation.
population_specificity: Individuals with knee osteoarthritis (n = 270) or chronic knee pain (n = 130).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness of non-pharmacological interventions, including massage, in improving sleep for inpatients in regular care wards.
results_summary: The meta-analysis revealed large pooled effects in favor of sleep improvement with massage, though the certainty of evidence ranged from moderate to very low.
population_specificity: Inpatients in regular care wards experiencing sleep disturbances.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of massage therapy, among other physical modalities, for migraine headache management.
results_summary: Studies on massage therapy for migraines were heterogeneous and of low quality, often combined with other manual therapies to show effect. While manual therapies, including massage, appeared to reduce pain and improve quality of life, further study is needed to determine the most effective types.
population_specificity: Patients with migraine headaches.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of Shujing Tongdu massage on patients with chronic lesions or spinal disorders.
results_summary: The intervention group showed significant improvements, including a 30% increase in lesion healing, reduced pain intensity, enhanced range of motion, and higher Quality of Life and Mental Well-being Index scores compared to the control group. Adverse effects were mild, primarily discomfort and muscle soreness.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic lesions or spinal disorders at a Traditional Chinese Medicine hospital in Shanghai.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of LipiFlow (a thermal pulsation system) compared to other treatments like warm compresses and thermostatic devices for managing dry eye disease (DED) and Meibomian gland dysfunction (MGD).
results_summary: LipiFlow showed similar effectiveness to other common DED treatments, with no significant differences in symptom scores, meibomian gland expression, or tear breakup time compared to basic warm compresses. Evidence was deemed low certainty due to high bias and methodological limitations.
population_specificity: Adults (ages 19–86) with DED or MGD, predominantly female (66%).
study_duration: Varied by study, with symptom assessments typically at four weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effectiveness of polyherbal gel applied via phonophoresis and superficial massage in relieving pain and stiffness and improving activities of daily living in industrial workers with musculoskeletal injuries.
results_summary: The study found that polyherbal gel applied with phonophoresis was more effective at reducing pain (measured by NPRS, WOMAC, and Global Pain Relief scales) compared to massage and standard diclofenac gel. The polyherbal gel showed significant improvements in pain relief and functionality.
population_specificity: Industrial workers with musculoskeletal injuries (n=200).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of massage combined with western medicine treatment in improving cognitive function in patients with mild cognitive impairment (MCI).
results_summary: The study found that massage + western medicine treatment ranked second in improving MMSE scores among the interventions analyzed, indicating a positive effect on cognitive function in MCI patients.
population_specificity: Patients with mild cognitive impairment (MCI).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of massage as a non-pharmacological therapy for reducing postoperative pain in children.
results_summary: Massage was found to be effective in reducing pediatric postoperative pain in two studies but ineffective in another, indicating mixed results. The abstract suggests that more evidence is needed to conclusively determine its efficacy.
population_specificity: Children undergoing surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Crigler massage promotes the resolution of congenital nasolacrimal duct obstruction (CNLDO) in infants under 1 year of age.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in resolution rates between massage and non-massage groups overall (31.4% vs. 33.3%). However, in protocol-compliant infants aged 3-5 months, the massage group showed a higher resolution rate (68.8% vs. 28.6%).
population_specificity: Infants aged 3-11 months with unilateral CNLDO.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of ice massage applied to the SP6 acupressure point during labor on pain, comfort, duration, and anxiety.
results_summary: Ice massage significantly reduced labor pain and anxiety while increasing comfort at various cervical dilation stages, with no adverse events reported.
population_specificity: 100 nulliparous women in labor.
effective_dosage: Rotational ice massage applied to the SP6 point on both legs at 4-5 cm, 6-7 cm, and 8-9 cm dilation during 3 contractions.
study_duration: Administered during the first stage of labor.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical efficacy of acupoint massage at Shenque (CV 8) for improving fatigue and sleep quality in patients with chronic fatigue syndrome (CFS).
results_summary: The study found that acupoint massage at Shenque (CV 8) significantly reduced physical and mental fatigue scores (FS-14) and improved sleep quality (PSQI) in CFS patients compared to the control group. The intervention was deemed effective for alleviating fatigue and enhancing sleep.
population_specificity: 71 patients diagnosed with chronic fatigue syndrome (CFS).
effective_dosage: 10 minutes per session, once every 2 days, 3 times a week.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore potential interventions, including perineal massage, that might reduce pelvic floor injuries during childbirth.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that perineal massage could logically reduce pelvic floor injuries, but notes that further study is needed to confirm its protective effects.
population_specificity: Primiparous women and those at risk of pelvic floor disorders due to childbirth.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the benefits and harms of pressure-garment therapy (PGT) for preventing hypertrophic scarring after burn injury, including comparisons with other scar-management therapies like lanolin massage.
results_summary: The evidence is very uncertain regarding the effectiveness of PGT compared to other therapies like lanolin massage or silicone, with no clear superiority in scar improvement, pain, pruritus, or adherence. Limited data and methodological heterogeneity prevent definitive conclusions.
population_specificity: Adults and children with burn injuries.
study_duration: Varies by study, with most having short follow-ups insufficient to assess long-term effects (typically less than 18 months).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether touch-massage® could reduce anxiety in patients hospitalized in a sterile hematology unit.
results_summary: Touch-massage® significantly reduced patient anxiety, with a mean decrease in STAI-State scale score of 10.6 compared to the control group, though self-esteem improvement was not significant.
population_specificity: Patients aged 18-65 with serious and progressive hematological pathologies, hospitalized in a sterile hematology unit for at least three weeks.
effective_dosage: 15-minute touch-massage® sessions once a week for three weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the evidence-based efficacy of dry needling compared to other treatments, including massage, for managing myofascial pain in patients with low back pain.
results_summary: The review found that dry needling effectively reduced post-intervention pain intensity and disability in patients with myofascial low back pain, though outcomes and follow-up periods varied across studies. Massage was mentioned as a comparison treatment but was not the primary focus of the analysis.
population_specificity: Patients with acute and chronic low back pain due to myofascial pain syndrome.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the certainty of evidence supporting massage as a TCM intervention for insomnia and its inclusion in clinical practice guidelines.
results_summary: The study found that massage, along with other TCM therapies, had limited high-certainty evidence supporting its efficacy, resulting in weak recommendations. Clinical studies on massage were relatively scarce, necessitating further research.
population_specificity: Insomnia patients (specific demographics not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of lacrimal sac massage in treating congenital nasolacrimal duct obstruction (CNLDO) in infants.
results_summary: The study found that 86.75% of infants recovered completely after 3 months of continuous lacrimal sac massage, while 12.31% required probing. Recovery was more likely in infants presenting at an earlier age.
population_specificity: Infants diagnosed with congenital nasolacrimal duct obstruction (CNLDO) in a tertiary care hospital in eastern Asia.
effective_dosage: Not specified (massage frequency implied to be continuous, with monthly reviews).
study_duration: Up to 12 months (with most recoveries occurring within 6 months).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of unilateral carotid sinus massage as a vagal maneuver for managing supraventricular tachycardia (SVT) in pediatric patients.
results_summary: The study found that vagal maneuvers, including unilateral carotid sinus massage, can be effective for hemodynamically stable pediatric patients with SVT, while pharmacologic therapies like adenosine or emergency cardioversion may be needed for unstable cases.
population_specificity: Pediatric patients (specifically infants and children) with supraventricular tachycardia (SVT).
effective_dosage: Not specified (intervention involves physical maneuver rather than dosage).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether non-invasive therapies, including massage, improve pain, pruritus, elasticity, and vascularisation in adults with burn scars, and if effects persist beyond the intervention period.
results_summary: Massage showed a beneficial effect on pain intensity (MD -1.5) and pruritus intensity (MD -0.4) but had negligible or unclear benefits on scar elasticity and vascularisation. The evidence quality was low to moderate.
population_specificity: Adults with burn scars

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify the most effective non-pharmacological therapy for chemotherapy-induced peripheral neurotoxicity (CIPN), with a focus on comparing massage to other interventions.
results_summary: The study found that massage was more effective than other non-pharmacological therapies (e.g., acupuncture, vitamin and gabapentin, usual care, and placebo) in alleviating pain, improving quality of life, and reducing peripheral neuropathological symptoms. It also outperformed sensorimotor training, electrostimulation, multimodal exercise, and resistance training in attenuating neuropathological symptoms.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing chemotherapy who experienced chemotherapy-induced peripheral neurotoxicity (CIPN).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of non-pharmacological interventions, including massage, for improving behavioral and psychological symptoms of dementia (BPSD).
results_summary: Massage plus treatment as usual (TAU) showed significant reductions in depression (CSDD) and agitation (CMAI), with moderate-certainty evidence. Massage combined with aromatherapy or music also outperformed TAU for agitation reduction.
population_specificity: Individuals with behavioral and psychological symptoms of dementia (BPSD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of tuina spinning and lifting technique on cervical spondylotic radiculopathy compared to oral neck pain granules alone.
results_summary: The study found that combining neck pain granules with tuina massage significantly improved Visual Analog Scale and Neck Dysfunction Index scores compared to neck pain granules alone, though no significant difference was observed on the Tanaka Yasuhisa Cervical Spondylosis Symptom Scale.
population_specificity: 25 patients with cervical spondylotic radiculopathy.
effective_dosage: Massage lifting technique once every two days; neck pain granules three times daily.
study_duration: 2 weeks of intervention, followed by 10 weeks of observational follow-up.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically review chronobiological factors, including massage therapy, affecting neonatal health in hospital settings.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings on massage therapy, only mentioning it as one of several factors reviewed. Empirical evidence for benefits from chronobiological interventions, including massage, was weaker than expected.
population_specificity: Hospitalized neonates in stable condition without congenital anomalies.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether combining Tuina massage with Chinese herbal compresses is more effective than Chinese herbal compresses alone for treating primary dysmenorrhea (PD) in women with cold coagulation and blood stasis syndrome.
results_summary: The study is the first RCT to evaluate this combination therapy for PD, with primary outcomes measured via VAS and secondary outcomes including symptom scores, anxiety/depression scales, and pain threshold. Results are pending, but the study posits that if effective, it could provide evidence for an alternative PD treatment.
population_specificity: 114 young women with PD from the Shanghai University of Traditional Chinese Medicine.
effective_dosage: Treatment administered once daily for 3 days before menstruation (3 times per menstrual cycle).
study_duration: 3 days per menstrual cycle (exact number of cycles not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of education based on message framing (gain vs. loss) delivered via WhatsApp on improving physical activity behavior in female university employees.
results_summary: The study found a significant increase in physical activity scores in both intervention groups, with a 53% improvement in the gain-framed message group and 15% in the loss-framed group, while the control group showed no significant change.
population_specificity: Female employees of universities and higher education institutions in Ahvaz city.
effective_dosage: Not specified (educational messages delivered via WhatsApp for one month).
study_duration: One month (with follow-up two months post-intervention).

study_goal: The study does not focus on Massage; it aims to compare the efficacy of a new end-on approach versus the conventional parallel technique for RFN of the CMBN in patients with chronic neck pain due to cervical facet joint disease.
results_summary: The study does not report any findings related to Massage; it is focused on comparing two RFN techniques.
population_specificity: Adults with chronic neck pain secondary to cervical facet joint disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically review the available evidence on the effect of spa therapy, including massage, on serotonin and dopamine function.
results_summary: The review found limited and heterogeneous evidence, with low methodological quality, making it difficult to draw clear conclusions about spa therapy's effects on serotonin and dopamine function. Only four studies were included, focusing on healthy individuals and fibromyalgia patients.
population_specificity: Healthy individuals and fibromyalgia patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of massage versus acupuncture on musculoskeletal pain in patients with advanced cancer.
results_summary: Massage significantly reduced worst pain scores (-3.01 points) and improved fatigue, insomnia, and quality of life over 26 weeks, with no significant difference compared to acupuncture. Adverse events were mild, primarily transient soreness (15.1% of patients).
population_specificity: Patients with advanced cancer, moderate to severe pain, clinician-estimated life expectancy ≥6 months, Karnofsky score ≥60, English or Spanish speakers, aged >18 years.
effective_dosage: Weekly sessions for 10 weeks, with monthly booster sessions up to 26 weeks.

study_goal: To explore the effects of aromatherapy massage combined with TCM emotional release technique on maternal and neonatal physical and mental health and family relationships in patients with postpartum depression.
results_summary: The combination of aromatherapy massage and emotional release technique reduced negative emotions, stress, and mania while improving positive emotions and family intimacy adaptability. The combined treatment group showed the highest levels of serotonin (5-HT) and dopamine (DA) and the best family intimacy adaptability compared to other groups.
population_specificity: 160 patients with postpartum depression admitted to the obstetrics department of Hebei 3a Hospital.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of online infant massage training on infant growth, mother-infant attachment, and mothers' self-confidence.
results_summary: Infants in the massage group showed significantly higher mean body weight at 8 weeks and mean height at 20 weeks compared to the control group. Maternal attachment and self-confidence scores were also higher for mothers in the massage group.
population_specificity: Healthy-term infants and their mothers in the postpartum period.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the reporting quality of massage interventions in randomized controlled trials for patients with neck pain to guide future clinical implementation and meta-analyses.
results_summary: The study found moderate completeness in reporting massage interventions, with variations in type, dose, and duration. Methodological quality was fair to good, and most trials provided sufficient details for clinical decision-making.
population_specificity: Patients with neck pain, primarily chronic non-specific neck pain (23 out of 35 trials).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the differences in clinical outcomes between osteosarcoma patients with and without prior massage manipulation therapy.
results_summary: The study found that massage therapy significantly increased LDH and ALP levels, led to higher amputation rates, and tripled the speed of metastasis onset, lowering survival rates.
population_specificity: Osteosarcoma patients in Indonesia with low socio-economic and educational status.
study_duration: Patients were followed for one year.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to consolidate evidence and provide recommendations for performing CPR during hyperbaric oxygen therapy (HBOT) due to the unique challenges it presents.
results_summary: The review identified 41 relevant publications, with 18 describing CPR or defibrillation in 22 HBOT patients. It highlighted the need for adapted guidelines to address the unique physiological conditions of HBOT.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing hyperbaric oxygen therapy (HBOT) who experienced cardiac arrest.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of dual-frequency ultrasound (LDM) for reducing postoperative perilesional ecchymosis and edema in patients after rhinoseptoplasty.
results_summary: The study found that LDM treatment significantly reduced the duration of postoperative ecchymosis (2.8 vs. 7.4 days) and edema (1.9 vs. 4.5 days) compared to conventional ice packs, with higher patient satisfaction in the LDM group.
population_specificity: Patients who underwent rhinoseptoplasty.
effective_dosage: Daily LDM treatment for 5 days starting postoperatively.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of massage on the physical growth parameters (height, weight, head circumference), feeding amount, and discharge time of preterm infants.
results_summary: Massage significantly improved height and weight by days 20 and 30, increased feeding amounts by days 15 and 30, and reduced discharge time by an average of 10 days compared to the control group.
population_specificity: Preterm infants
effective_dosage: Massage administered for 30 days (frequency not specified)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of Tuina massage compared to traction therapy in treating chronic low back pain (cLBP).
results_summary: The study compared Tuina massage (kneading, rolling, plucking, and oblique pulling) to traction therapy over 4 weeks, measuring outcomes like anxiety, pain, and quality of life. Results were not fully detailed in the abstract, but primary and secondary outcomes were assessed at multiple time points.
population_specificity: 94 patients with chronic low back pain.
effective_dosage: Three treatments per week for 4 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to map orofacial and cervical myofunctional intervention programs for older adults, evaluate current research, and suggest further investigation.
results_summary: The study found that therapeutic programs, including myofunctional exercises and salivary gland massage, positively influenced the stomatognathic system in older adults, improving functionality and preventing disorders.
population_specificity: Older adults aged 60+ years, predominantly female, from the United States, Japan, and South Korea.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of the Mézières Method (MM) versus a program of heat, massage, and exercise on pain and disability related to chronic low back pain (LBP) and to understand participants' bodily experience with MM.
results_summary: Both treatments showed positive effects on LBP, but the MM group demonstrated superior short-term pain relief. Participants perceived MM as a teaching-learning process that enhanced body awareness and facilitated LBP management.
population_specificity: 61 participants aged 18-65 with chronic non-specific LBP lasting more than 3 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically evaluate the prevalence and utilization of complementary and integrative medicine (CIM), including massage, among active-duty military personnel and veterans globally.
results_summary: The study found that massage was one of the most commonly used CIM therapies, with utilization rates varying widely (1.9% to 90%). The overall quality of evidence was high, indicating reliable findings.
population_specificity: Active-duty military personnel and veterans.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of non-pharmacological interventions, including massage, in improving post-stroke dysphagia outcomes.
results_summary: The study found that acupuncture + rehabilitation training + massage had significant effects in improving post-stroke dysphagia, particularly in measures like VFSS, SSA, SWAL-QOL, and WST, compared to other interventions.
population_specificity: Post-stroke dysphagia patients

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify nursing support components, including abdominal massage, for relieving breathlessness in cancer patients.
results_summary: The study identified abdominal massage as one of 12 nursing support components for breathlessness relief in cancer patients, but specific efficacy data for massage alone were not detailed.
population_specificity: Adult patients (aged ≥18 years) with cancer experiencing breathlessness.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the potential health benefits of using massage chairs, focusing on both physical and mental health outcomes.
results_summary: The review found that massage chairs may positively impact cognitive function, stress reduction, mental fatigue, muscle stiffness, pain, and quality of life, with more significant benefits observed in mental health. However, two case reports indicated complications.
population_specificity: Not specified (general population inferred from included studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of different noninvasive traditional Chinese medicine (TCM) external therapies, including massage, in preventing postpartum urinary retention (PUR).
results_summary: The study found that acupoint massage combined with auricular acupressure was moderately effective in reducing the incidence of PUR, shortening urination time, and decreasing residual urine volume, ranking third and fourth in efficacy among the tested interventions.
population_specificity: Postpartum women (parturients)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effectiveness of interferential current (IC) combined with massage or exercises compared to these interventions alone in reducing pain intensity and disability in patients with chronic non-specific low back pain.
results_summary: Very low-quality evidence suggests that IC combined with massage or exercises may not further reduce pain intensity and disability compared to massage or exercises alone immediately post-treatment.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic non-specific low back pain.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of a bowel rehabilitation program combining digital rectal stimulation (DRS) and abdominal massage for stroke patients with neurogenic bowel dysfunction (NBD).
results_summary: The study is ongoing, so specific results are not yet reported, but it aims to assess outcomes like Wexner score, Bristol score, and quality of life measures (PAC-QoL and FI-QoL) to determine the program's efficacy.
population_specificity: Stroke patients with neurogenic bowel dysfunction (NBD).
effective_dosage: Not specified (intervention combines DRS and abdominal massage).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of back massage with frankincense and myrrh oil on back pain severity and comfort in patients undergoing cardiac electrophysiological study.
results_summary: Back massage with frankincense and myrrh oil increased overall comfort, physical comfort, and psychospiritual comfort, but there was no statistically significant difference in post-procedure pain severity between groups.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing cardiac electrophysiological study at a heart hospital in Turkey.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether pulmonary recruitment maneuvers could reduce post-laparoscopic shoulder pain in patients undergoing laparoscopic cholecystectomy.
results_summary: The study found that pulmonary recruitment maneuvers significantly reduced shoulder pain (p-value 0.001) with a high effect size (0.527), while sedation scores showed no significant difference between groups.
population_specificity: Sixty patients undergoing laparoscopic cholecystectomy.
effective_dosage: Five manual pulmonary inflations for 5 s at a maximum pressure of 25 cm H₂O.
study_duration: Administered at the end of laparoscopic surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the efficacy of physical therapy and rehabilitation approaches, including massage, for chronic migraine (CM) and their impact on quality of life and disability.
results_summary: Connective tissue massage (CTM) reduced the intensity of headache in CM patients, though acupressure as an adjunct to medication did not show additional benefits on headache intensity or QoL.
population_specificity: Adults with chronic migraine.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether uterine massage before placental delivery affects the third stage of labor and postpartum hemorrhage in vaginal deliveries.
results_summary: Uterine massage significantly shortened placental delivery time and reduced postpartum hemorrhage, with lower hemoglobin drops and fewer transfusion needs in the massage group.
population_specificity: 242 women who gave birth vaginally at Istanbul Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital.
effective_dosage: Not specified (uterine massage duration was recorded but not standardized).
study_duration: Single intervention during the third stage of labor.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the efficacy of scar massage techniques for managing hypertrophic burn scar symptoms such as contraction, pruritus, pain, and visibility.
results_summary: Nine out of ten studies showed significant improvement in hypertrophic burn scar symptoms with scar massage, with different techniques addressing specific symptoms—friction and oscillation improved function, while effleurage and petrissage improved visibility and pain. Pruritus improved across all techniques.
population_specificity: Patients with hypertrophic burn scars.
effective_dosage: Not specified (different massage techniques were used, with longer sessions noted for effleurage and petrissage).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of dynamic stretching, static stretching, and percussive massage therapy on balance and physical performance in individuals.
results_summary: Percussive massage therapy (PMT) showed significant improvements in all measured parameters (t-test, horizontal jumping test, and balance) compared to static stretching (SS). PMT also outperformed SS in all group comparisons.
population_specificity: Individuals aged 18-25 without orthopedic surgery, running/turning issues, or professional sports history.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of soft tissue manual therapy (massage) and therapeutic exercises in reducing pain, muscle tension, and improving mandibular mobility in female patients with myofascial pain and restricted mobility.
results_summary: Massage combined with therapeutic exercises (MTM_TE) showed significant reductions in pain intensity and muscle tension (sEMG activity), with analgesic effects observed after just one treatment. Massage also outperformed post-isometric relaxation (PIR) in improving mandibular mobility and pain relief.
population_specificity: 82 women diagnosed with myofascial pain and restricted mobility (DC/TMD Ib disorder).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of perineal massage and pelvic floor muscle training (PFMT) during late pregnancy on postpartum pelvic floor function in nulliparas.
results_summary: Perineal massage alone did not show significant improvements in pelvic floor electromyography (EMG) or pelvic organ prolapse quantitation (POP-Q) compared to controls. PFMT, however, enhanced pelvic floor EMG and reduced POP-Q measurements, but combining PFMT with perineal massage did not yield additional benefits.
population_specificity: Nulliparas (first-time mothers) in late pregnancy.
effective_dosage: Not specified (intervention involved perineal massage and PFMT from 34 weeks of gestation until delivery).
study_duration: From 34 weeks of gestation until delivery.
